FacilityName: CITY OF DICKSON WATER TREATMENT PLANT

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
THE CITY OF DICKSON WATER TREATMENT PLANT RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM IS TAILORED AROUND THE E.P.A. PREVENTION PROGRAM.

DICKSON WATER DEPARTMENT HAS A CHLORINATION ROOM,WHICH CONTAINS LIQUID CHLORINE CONTAINERS, A CHLORINATOR AND VARIOUS SAFETY EQUIPMENT, AND AN INSTRUMENT ROOM, WHICH CONTAINS ADDITIONAL SAFETY EQUIPMENT.THE AMOUNT OF CHLORINE ON HAND IS TWO ONE TON CONTAINERS. THE FACILITY IS MANNED 7 DAY A WEEK 24 HOURS A DAY.WATER TREATMENT OPERATOR ARE RESPONABLE FOR CHECKING SAFETY EQUIPMENT AND FOLLOWING ALL SAFETY PROCEDURES.

THE OFFSITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS INCLUDES CONSIDERATION OF TWO ONE TON CHLORINE RELEASE SCENARIO,INDENTIFIED AS" WORST CASE RELEASE" AND "ALTERNATIVE SCENARIO".THE WORST CASE BEING DEFINED AS THE LARGEST VESSEL... IS RELEASED AS A GAS OVER 10 MINUTES",DUE TO UNSPECIFIED FAILURE.THE ALTERNATIVE SCENARIO IS DEFINED AS THE MOST LIKELY TO OCCUR THAN THE WORST CASE.

THE WORST-CASE RELEASE SCENARIO AT THE DICKSON WATER DEPT. INVOLVES A FAILURE OF THE TWO-TON-CONTAINERS WHICH COULD BE CONNECTED CONCURRENTLY (A TOTALF 4000 LB OF CHLORINE).  THE OFFSITE CONSEQENCE ANALYSIS FOR THIS SCENARIO WAS PERFORMED FOR TWO SETS OF CONDITIONS.  THE FIRST SET FOLLOWED CONDITIONS PRE-DEFINED BY EPA, NAMELY ERPG-2 AS THE TOXIC ENDPOINT, AND CONSIDERATION OF THE POPULATION RESIDING WITHIN A FULL CIRCLE RADIUS CORRESPONDING TO THE TOXIC ENDPOINT DISTANCE.  WHEN ATMOSPHERIC DISPERSION MODELING FOR THE WORST CASE SCENARIO WAS PERFORMED USING THE EPA ASSUMPTIONS, A DISTANCE TO TOXIC ENDPOINT OF 1.3 MILES AND AN ESTIMATE OF RESIDENTIAL POPULATION POTENTIALLY AFFECTED OF 13000 WAS OBTAINED.  WHEN THE SAME MODELING WAS  PERFORMED WITH THE SECOND SET OF CONDITIONS, A DISTANCE TO TOXIC ENDPOINT OF .2 MILES AN ESTIMATE OF POPULATION POTENTIALLY AFFECTED OF 1000 RESULTED.                                                                                                                                                         

THE GENERAL DWP ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGR

AM IS BASED ON THE FOLLOWINGKEY ELEMENTS:
 ***    HIGH LEVEL OF TRAINING OF THE OPERATORS
 ***    PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE PROGRAM
 ***    USE OF SAFETY EGUIPMENT( WALLANE & TIERNAN ACUTEC 35 GAS DETECTOR).
 ***    USE OF EFFECTIVE OPERATING PROCEDURES, WITH EMPLOYEE PARTICIPATION.
 ***    PERFORMANCE OF A HAZAED REVEIW OF EQUIPMENT AND PROCEDURES.                                         ***   IMPEMENTATION OF AN AUDITING AND INSPECTION PROGRAM.
                                                           
 NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF CHLORINE HAVE OCCURRED AT THIS FACILITY IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS.  

THE FACILITY HAS AN EMERGENCY REPONSE PROGRAM, WHICH HAS BEEN COORDINATED BY THE LOCAL EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLANNING COMMITTEE.  THIS PROGRAM INCLUDES AN EMERGENCY RESPONSE DECISION TREE AND A NOTIFICATION PLAN.  EMERGENCY RESPONSE DRILLS AND DRILL EVALUATION ARE CONDUCTED EVERY SIX MONTHS; EMERGENCY OPERATION AND RESPONSE PROCEDURES ARE ALSO REVIEWED AT THAT TIME.
